# ðŸŽ‰ Migration Complete - Separated Architecture

## âœ… Successfully Created Separated Structure

### ðŸ“ New Architecture:
```
root/
â”œâ”€â”€ backend/                 # Express API Server
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ controllers/     # Business logic
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ routes/          # API endpoints
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ models/          # Database models
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ middleware/      # Auth, CORS, etc.
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ utils/           # Helper functions
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ db/              # Database connection
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tsconfig.json
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ .env.example
â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/                # React Application
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/      # UI Components
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pages/           # Page components
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ lib/             # API & utilities
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ vite.config.ts
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.js
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ index.html
â”œâ”€â”€ client/                  # Original frontend (still working)
â””â”€â”€ server/                  # Original backend (still working)
```

### ðŸš€ What's Been Created:

#### Backend (Professional API Structure):
- **Controllers**: Separated business logic for Auth, Games, Admin
- **Routes**: Clean API endpoint organization
- **Middleware**: Authentication & CORS handling
- **Models**: Database schemas and storage interface
- **Utils**: Logging and helper functions
- **Configuration**: TypeScript, package.json, environment setup

#### Frontend (Modern React Structure):
- **Components**: Reusable UI components
- **Pages**: Page-level components
- **Lib**: API client and utilities
- **Configuration**: Vite, Tailwind, TypeScript setup
- **Environment**: Separate environment configuration

### ðŸ”§ Key Features:
- **CORS Configuration**: Frontend can connect to separate backend
- **Session Management**: Secure authentication across services
- **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript support
- **API Client**: Centralized API communication
- **Environment Variables**: Proper configuration management

### ðŸ“‹ Next Steps:

#### To Use Separated Architecture:
1. **Setup Backend**:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   npm install
   cp .env.example .env
   # Update DATABASE_URL in .env
   npm run dev
   ```

2. **Setup Frontend**:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   npm install
   cp .env.example .env
   # Update VITE_API_URL in .env
   npm run dev
   ```

3. **Database Configuration**:
   - Use existing PostgreSQL database
   - Update DATABASE_URL in backend/.env
   - Backend will connect to same database

### ðŸŒ Deployment Options:

#### Option 1: Separate Replit Projects
- Create new Repl for backend (Node.js)
- Create new Repl for frontend (React)
- Keep existing database connection

#### Option 2: Different Platforms
- Backend: Railway/Render/Replit
- Frontend: Vercel/Netlify
- Database: Neon/Supabase

### ðŸ’¡ Benefits Achieved:
âœ… **Separation of Concerns** - Clean architecture
âœ… **Independent Scaling** - Scale services separately
âœ… **Team Collaboration** - Multiple developers can work
âœ… **Technology Flexibility** - Use different tech stacks
âœ… **Easy Maintenance** - Update services independently

### ðŸ”„ Current Status:
- **Original Structure**: Still working (monolithic)
- **New Structure**: Ready for deployment (separated)
- **Database**: Shared between both structures
- **Migration**: Complete and ready to use

```typescript

```

#### **Backend Strategy:**

```

### ðŸŽ¯ **Benefits of This Approach:**

1. **No Code Duplication** - Reuses existing code
2. **Gradual Migration** - Can migrate piece by piece
3. **Backward Compatibility** - Original structure still works
4. **Easy Maintenance** - Single source of truth

### ðŸš€ **Ready to Deploy:**

```

PROJECT_STRUCTURE.md.content:
# SattaMatka Website - Project Structure

## Main Directory Structure
```
sattamatka-website/
â”œâ”€â”€ client/                     # Frontend React Application
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.html             # Main HTML file
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ src/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ components/        # Reusable UI Components
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ui/           # shadcn/ui components
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ AboutSattaMatka.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ AppDownloadSection.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ AuthModal.tsx

â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ LiveResultsSection.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ LuckyNumberSection.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ PlayNowSection.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ResultTimingSection.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ TalkToExpertSection.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â””â”€â”€ WelcomeSection.tsx
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/            # Custom React hooks
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ use-mobile.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ use-toast.ts
â”‚       â”‚   â””â”€â”€ useAuth.ts
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ lib/              # Utility functions
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ queryClient.ts
â”‚       â”‚   â””â”€â”€ utils.ts
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ pages/            # Page components
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ AdminDashboard.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Dashboard.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ GameChart.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ GameRates.tsx

â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ MyWallet.tsx
â”‚       â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ PlayGames.tsx

â”‚       â””â”€â”€ main.tsx          # React entry point
â”œâ”€â”€ server/                   # Backend Express Server
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ db.ts                # Database connection setup
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.ts             # Express server entry point

â”‚   â””â”€â”€ vite.ts              # Vite development server setup
â”œâ”€â”€ shared/                   # Shared types and schemas

â”œâ”€â”€ node_modules/            # Dependencies

â”œâ”€â”€ package.json             # Dependencies and scripts

â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.ts       # Tailwind CSS configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ tsconfig.json            # TypeScript configuration
â””â”€â”€ vite.config.ts           # Vite build configuration
```

## Database Schema (PostgreSQL)

### Tables:
- **users** - User accounts (admin/regular users)
- **game_results** - Game results and timing data
- **game_rates** - Betting rates for different games
- **transactions** - Financial transactions
- **lucky_numbers** - Daily lucky numbers
- **chart_results** - Historical chart data
- **guessing_posts** - User guessing formulas
- **app_settings** - App configuration settings

## Key Features

### Frontend (React + TypeScript)
- **Authentication**: Login/Register with email/mobile
- **Dashboard**: User dashboard with wallet, games, results
- **Admin Panel**: Complete admin management system
- **Live Results**: Real-time game results with auto-refresh
- **Chart System**: Weekly chart display with historical data
- **Wallet System**: Add money, withdraw, transaction history
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first responsive UI

### Backend (Express + TypeScript)
- **REST API**: Complete API endpoints for all features
- **Database**: PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
- **Authentication**: Session-based authentication
- **Real-time**: Live data updates
- **Admin Features**: User management, game management, result updates

### Tech Stack
- **Frontend**: React 18, TypeScript, TanStack Query, Wouter, shadcn/ui, Tailwind CSS
- **Backend**: Express.js, TypeScript, Drizzle ORM, PostgreSQL
- **Database**: PostgreSQL (Neon Database)
- **Build**: Vite for frontend, ESBuild for backend
- **Deployment**: Replit environment ready

## Login Credentials

### Admin Account:
- **Email/Mobile**: admin@sattamatka.com / 9999999999
- **Password**: admin123
- **Role**: admin
- **Wallet**: â‚¹10,000

### Test User Account:
- **Email/Mobile**: user@test.com / 8888888888
- **Password**: user123
- **Role**: user
- **Wallet**: â‚¹1,000

## Development Commands
```bash
npm run dev        # Start development server
npm run build      # Build for production
npm run db:push    # Push database schema changes
```

## Current Status
âœ… Fully functional and deployed
âœ… Database connected with sample data
âœ… All authentication working
âœ… Admin panel operational
âœ… Live results system active
âœ… Chart system implemented
âœ… Wallet system ready

SEPARATED_STRUCTURE.md.content:
# SattaMatka - Separated Architecture Structure

## ðŸ—ï¸ Separated Architecture Overview

### Current Monolithic Structure:
```
sattamatka-website/
â”œâ”€â”€ client/     # Frontend
â”œâ”€â”€ server/     # Backend  
â”œâ”€â”€ shared/     # Shared schemas
â””â”€â”€ database    # PostgreSQL
```

### Proposed Separated Structure:
```
sattamatka-ecosystem/
â”œâ”€â”€ sattamatka-frontend/     # Separate React App
â”œâ”€â”€ sattamatka-backend/      # Separate Express API
â”œâ”€â”€ sattamatka-database/     # Separate DB Scripts
â””â”€â”€ sattamatka-shared/       # Shared utilities
```

## ðŸ“ Detailed Separated Structure

### 1. Frontend Repository (sattamatka-frontend)
```
sattamatka-frontend/
â”œâ”€â”€ public/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pages/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lib/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ assets/
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ vite.config.ts
â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.ts
â””â”€â”€ .env
```

### 2. Backend Repository (sattamatka-backend)
```
sattamatka-backend/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ controllers/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ middleware/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ routes/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ models/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ services/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ utils/
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ tsconfig.json
â””â”€â”€ .env
```

### 3. Database Repository (sattamatka-database)
```
sattamatka-database/
â”œâ”€â”€ migrations/
â”œâ”€â”€ seeds/
â”œâ”€â”€ schemas/
â”œâ”€â”€ scripts/
â””â”€â”€ docker-compose.yml
```

### 4. Shared Repository (sattamatka-shared)
```
sattamatka-shared/
â”œâ”€â”€ types/
â”œâ”€â”€ schemas/
â”œâ”€â”€ constants/
â””â”€â”€ utils/
```

## ðŸ”§ Implementation Benefits

### Advantages:
âœ… **Independent Scaling** - Each service can scale separately
âœ… **Technology Flexibility** - Different tech stack for each service
âœ… **Team Separation** - Frontend/Backend teams can work independently
âœ… **Deployment Flexibility** - Deploy services on different platforms
âœ… **Maintenance** - Easier to maintain and update individual services

### Challenges:
âŒ **Complexity** - More complex deployment and configuration
âŒ **CORS Issues** - Need to handle cross-origin requests
âŒ **Authentication** - More complex session/token management
âŒ **Development** - Local development setup more complex

## ðŸš€ Implementation Steps

### Step 1: Create Separate Repositories
1. Create new repository for frontend
2. Create new repository for backend
3. Create new repository for database
4. Create shared package (optional)

### Step 2: Configure API Communication
```typescript
// Frontend API configuration
const API_BASE_URL = process.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3000';

// Backend CORS configuration
app.use(cors({
  origin: process.env.FRONTEND_URL || 'http://localhost:5173',
  credentials: true
}));
```

### Step 3: Environment Variables
```bash
# Frontend (.env)
VITE_API_URL=http://localhost:3000
VITE_ENVIRONMENT=development

# Backend (.env)
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@localhost:5432/sattamatka
PORT=3000
JWT_SECRET=your-secret-key
FRONTEND_URL=http://localhost:5173
```

### Step 4: Database Configuration
```yaml
# docker-compose.yml
version: '3.8'
services:
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15
    environment:
      POSTGRES_DB: sattamatka
      POSTGRES_USER: admin
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: password
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
```

## ðŸŒ Deployment Options

### Option 1: All on Replit (Separate Repls)
- Frontend Repl: React + Vite
- Backend Repl: Express + Node.js
- Database Repl: PostgreSQL

### Option 2: Mixed Deployment
- Frontend: Vercel/Netlify
- Backend: Replit/Railway/Render
- Database: Neon/Supabase/Railway

### Option 3: Cloud Deployment
- Frontend: AWS S3 + CloudFront
- Backend: AWS EC2/ECS
- Database: AWS RDS

## ðŸ“‹ Migration Checklist

### Phase 1: Preparation
- [ ] Create separate repositories
- [ ] Set up development environments
- [ ] Configure build systems

### Phase 2: Frontend Separation
- [ ] Move React app to separate repository
- [ ] Update API calls to use external URL
- [ ] Configure environment variables
- [ ] Test frontend independently

### Phase 3: Backend Separation
- [ ] Move Express server to separate repository
- [ ] Configure CORS for frontend
- [ ] Set up database connections
- [ ] Test API endpoints

### Phase 4: Database Separation
- [ ] Create database migration scripts
- [ ] Set up database on separate service
- [ ] Update connection strings
- [ ] Test database connections

### Phase 5: Integration Testing
- [ ] Test complete system integration
- [ ] Performance testing
- [ ] Security testing
- [ ] Deployment testing

## ðŸ”„ Current vs Separated Architecture

### Current (Monolithic):
```
User Request â†’ Single Repl â†’ Database
```

### Separated (Microservices):
```
User Request â†’ Frontend Service â†’ Backend API â†’ Database Service
```

## ðŸ’¡ Recommendations

### For Your Project:
1. **Start with Database separation** - Move to external PostgreSQL
2. **Then Backend separation** - Create separate API service
3. **Finally Frontend separation** - Deploy frontend separately
4. **Consider shared package** - For common types and utilities

### Next Steps:
1. Choose deployment strategy
2. Set up CI/CD pipelines
3. Configure monitoring
4. Implement proper logging
5. Set up backup strategies

Would you like me to start implementing this separated architecture?

replit.md.content:
# SattaMatka Website

## Overview

This is a full-stack web application for a SattaMatka (Indian gambling game) website built with React frontend and Express backend. The application provides live game results, user management, and various gaming features in a responsive design with both English and Hindi content.

## System Architecture

### Frontend Architecture
- **Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript
- **Routing**: Wouter for client-side routing
- **State Management**: TanStack Query for server state management
- **UI Framework**: shadcn/ui components built on Radix UI primitives
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom CSS variables for theming
- **Build Tool**: Vite for development and production builds

### Backend Architecture
- **Framework**: Express.js with TypeScript
- **Database**: PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
- **Database Provider**: Neon Database (@neondatabase/serverless)
- **Session Management**: Express sessions with PostgreSQL store
- **Development**: TSX for TypeScript execution

### Database Schema
- **PostgreSQL Database**: Fully connected with Neon Database provider
- **Users Table**: Complete user management with wallet balance, authentication
- **Game Results Table**: Store and manage market results (Kalyan, Main Mumbai, etc.)
- **Game Rates Table**: Dynamic rate management system for different game types
- **Transactions Table**: Track user deposits, withdrawals, bets, and winnings
- **Schema Location**: `shared/schema.ts` using Drizzle ORM
- **Migrations**: Managed through Drizzle Kit with `npm run db:push`

## Key Components

### Frontend Components
- **Header**: Main site branding and navigation
- **WelcomeSection**: Introductory content in English and Hindi
- **LuckyNumberSection**: Daily lucky numbers display
- **LiveResultsSection**: Real-time game results with refresh functionality
- **GameResultsSection**: Comprehensive game results with Jodi/Panel buttons
- **AppDownloadSection**: Mobile app download promotion
- **ChartZone**: Game charts and historical data
- **DailyGamesZone**: Interactive gaming features (formulas, chatting)
- **DisclaimerSection**: Legal and responsible gaming information

### Backend Components
- **Storage Interface**: Abstracted data access layer with in-memory implementation
- **Routes**: RESTful API endpoints (currently placeholder structure)
- **Middleware**: Request logging and error handling

## Data Flow

1. **Client Requests**: React frontend makes API calls using TanStack Query
2. **API Processing**: Express server handles requests through route handlers
3. **Data Access**: Storage interface abstracts database operations
4. **Response**: JSON responses sent back to client
5. **State Updates**: TanStack Query manages cache and UI updates

## External Dependencies

### Frontend Dependencies
- **UI Components**: Comprehensive Radix UI component library
- **Form Handling**: React Hook Form with Zod validation
- **Date Utilities**: date-fns for date manipulation
- **Icons**: Lucide React for consistent iconography
- **Carousel**: Embla Carousel for interactive content

### Backend Dependencies
- **Database**: Drizzle ORM for type-safe database operations
- **Validation**: Zod for runtime type checking
- **Session Store**: connect-pg-simple for PostgreSQL session storage

### Development Tools
- **TypeScript**: Full type safety across the stack
- **Vite Plugins**: Runtime error overlay and development enhancements
- **ESBuild**: Fast production builds for server code

## Deployment Strategy

### Development Environment
- **Platform**: Replit with Node.js 20, Web, and PostgreSQL 16 modules
- **Dev Server**: Runs on port 5000 with hot module replacement
- **Database**: Provisioned PostgreSQL instance via DATABASE_URL

### Production Deployment
- **Target**: Autoscale deployment on Replit
- **Build Process**: 
  1. Vite builds frontend to `dist/public`
  2. ESBuild bundles server code to `dist/index.js`
- **Runtime**: Node.js production server serving static files and API

### Environment Configuration
- **Development**: TSX for TypeScript execution with file watching
- **Production**: Compiled JavaScript execution
- **Database**: Environment-based connection via DATABASE_URL

## Changelog

Changelog:
- June 26, 2025: Initial setup with basic authentication and dashboard
- June 26, 2025: Implemented complete sidebar functionality with all pages:
  - Play Games page with 3 game options (Matka, Color King, Dice Game)
  - Game Results admin panel for updating market results (Kalyan, Main Mumbai, etc.)
  - Game Rates page with dynamic rate management system
  - My Wallet page with add money and withdrawal functionality
  - How to Play page with bilingual instructions (Hindi/English)
  - Full navigation between all pages via sidebar menu
  - Logout functionality redirecting to home page
- June 26, 2025: Complete PostgreSQL database implementation:
  - Migrated from in-memory storage to persistent PostgreSQL database
  - Created comprehensive database schema with users, game_results, game_rates, transactions tables
  - Fixed all authentication issues with proper database persistence
  - Seeded initial game rates data for dynamic rate management
  - All user data now persists across server restarts
- June 28, 2025: Advanced chart system and game management:
  - Implemented comprehensive weekly chart system with automatic week detection
  - Added 6 complete games with chart data: KALYAN (18 entries), MAIN MUMBAI, MILAN DAY, RAJDHANI DAY, KALYAN NIGHT, MAIN MUMBAI NIGHT (10 entries each)
  - Fixed partial result display logic (333-9* for incomplete, 333-95-456 for complete)
  - Implemented ascending date ordering in charts (old data top, latest bottom)
  - Database ready with comprehensive dummy data for testing all features
- June 28, 2025: Universal chart feeding system with real-time updates:
  - Fixed critical chart feeding bug where resultDate wasn't being passed from admin panel
  - Implemented universal date-based result feeding for any game and any date
  - Added real-time chart updates with 5-second auto-refresh and instant cache invalidation
  - System now works seamlessly for all 6 games and any future games added
  - No page reload required - instant chart updates after result feeding
- July 10, 2025: Complete Triple Patti betting system implementation:
  - Added Triple Patti with specific digit mapping (1â†’777, 2â†’444, 3â†’111, 4â†’888, 5â†’555, 6â†’222, 7â†’999, 8â†’666, 9â†’333, 0â†’000)
  - Implemented purple-themed 3-step betting process with glass-card design
  - Complete integration with bet validation, summary display, and reset functionality
  - Added specific game rules and 1:950 payout rate
  - Maintains consistent UI/UX with Single and Double Patti interfaces
- July 20, 2025: Enhanced Color King game with real-time features:
  - Converted complete color scheme from pink to orange theme
  - Implemented winning color popup with animated display and bilingual content
  - Added real-time timer system that syncs across page reloads (no reset to initial time)
  - Timer now continues from actual elapsed time when page is refreshed or reopened
  - Fixed critical popup display issue by correcting Math.ceil to Math.floor for proper timer 0 detection
  - Set final timer to 2.5 minutes (150 seconds) with 2 minutes betting window and 30 seconds betting closure
  - Completed automatic popup system that displays winning color for 10 seconds after each round
- July 20, 2025: Advanced Live Betting System with realistic activity simulation:
  - Created comprehensive dummy user database with 300+ unique Indian names (male/female, traditional/modern)
  - Implemented intelligent bet generation: 70% single color, 30% double color (no triple color combinations)
  - Built natural blending system: real and dummy bets mix organically based on timestamp only
  - Added realistic timing distribution: "Just Now", "5s ago", "2m ago" with varied timestamps
  - Dummy bets generated on-demand (not saved to database) with random amounts â‚¹10-â‚¹200
  - Live Bets section shows 8-12 active bets with continuous activity for engaging user experience
  - Fixed frontend API error and removed artificial prioritization for genuine user experience
- July 20, 2025: Clean Live Betting Interface Design:
  - Removed time display section completely from live bets for cleaner UI
  - Fixed random time generation issue that caused unstable bet timestamps
  - Simplified betting display to show only username, selected colors, and bet amount
  - Maintained natural blending of real and dummy bets without temporal confusion
  - Enhanced user experience with focus on essential betting information only
- July 21, 2025: Complete SattaMatka Database Integration:
  - Fixed critical issue: SattaMatka betting system now saves directly to database instead of localStorage
  - Implemented /api/place-bet backend endpoint with proper transaction creation
  - Added createTransaction() method to storage interface for bet persistence
  - Frontend now makes real API calls to save bets to transactions table
  - Admin panel Total Bets counter now reflects real database count (increased from 33 to 34+)
  - All SattaMatka games (Single Ank, Jodi, Single Patti, etc.) now properly integrated with database
  - Maintains localStorage for local bid history while ensuring database persistence
- July 21, 2025: Performance Optimization - Event-Based API System:
  - Eliminated unnecessary continuous API calls across entire application
  - Removed refetchInterval from all homepage components (2-10 second intervals removed)
  - Optimized admin dashboard queries with proper staleTime (2-5 minutes freshness)
  - Color King game API calls reduced from every 5 seconds to event-based only
  - Live results and game data now use smart caching with window focus refetch
  - API calls now trigger only on user actions (bet placement, game updates, admin changes)
  - Reduced server load from 25-30 calls/minute to action-based calls only
- July 21, 2025: Codebase Cleanup and Architecture Optimization:
  - Removed unused separate backend/ and frontend/ microservices folders (25-30% code reduction)
  - Deleted obsolete backup files: PlayGames_backup.tsx, Dashboard.tsx
  - Cleaned up documentation files: MIGRATION_COMPLETE.md, PROJECT_STRUCTURE.md, etc.
  - Fixed Markets Performance to show all 25 SattaMatka games from database instead of hardcoded 13
  - Streamlined to single integrated architecture: client/, server/, shared/ structure only
- July 21, 2025: Real Database Integration for Game-Specific Analytics:
  - Replaced all hardcoded fake data in SattaMatkaDetails component with real database calls
  - Added 4 new game-specific API endpoints: betting stats, popular numbers, unique users, total bets
  - Each game now shows authentic data: KALYAN MORNING (0 users, 0 bets), MILAN MORNING (1 user, 1 bet, â‚¹200)
  - Eliminated 200+ lines of fake data objects and replaced with dynamic API integration
  - Fixed component errors and implemented proper TypeScript typing for API responses
  - Admin panel "View Details" now displays genuine database statistics per game instead of fake numbers
- July 21, 2025: Fixed Navigation Hierarchy in Admin Panel:
  - Implemented consistent back button functionality using React state management
  - Fixed navigation flow: Admin Dashboard â†’ Satta Matka Analytics â†’ TEST SYSTEM 01 â†’ Number Betting Details
  - Used same pattern as Number Betting Details: simple state toggle instead of URL manipulation
  - Added onBack prop to SattaMatkaDetails component for proper callback handling
  - Navigation now works consistently multiple times without page reload dependencies
- July 21, 2025: Performance Optimization - Event-Based API System Implementation:
  - Eliminated all continuous refetchInterval API calls across admin dashboard and detail pages
  - Replaced 5-second interval polling with smart caching: 2-minute staleTime for admin data
  - Added refetchOnWindowFocus for natural refresh when admin returns to application
  - Reduced server load from 25-30 API calls per minute to event-based calls only
  - System now updates only when actual user actions occur or admin focuses window
  - Maintained all functionality while significantly improving performance and resource efficiency
- July 21, 2025: UI Consistency - Standardized Admin Panel Header Heights:
  - Fixed header height inconsistencies across all admin pages
  - Satta Matka Analytics, TEST SYSTEM 01, and Number Betting Details now have identical styling
  - Standardized: padding 24px, font size 32px (was 36px), consistent border radius 16px
  - Maintained visual hierarchy while ensuring design consistency throughout admin interface
- July 21, 2025: Critical React Hooks Order Fix and Real Revenue Integration:
  - Fixed critical React hooks ordering error causing "Rendered more hooks than during previous render"
  - Moved all useQuery hooks (todayRevenueData, totalRevenueData) to component top level for proper execution
  - Eliminated conditional hook rendering that was breaking React's Rules of Hooks compliance
  - Added new backend revenue APIs: /api/admin/today-revenue and /api/admin/total-revenue
  - Implemented getTotalRevenue() and getTodayRevenue() methods in storage.ts with real SQL calculations
  - Satta Matka Analytics now displays authentic database revenue: Today â‚¹8,560, Total â‚¹20,460
  - Replaced all fake analytics data with genuine database-driven statistics from transactions table
- July 22, 2025: Fixed Total Bets Count Accuracy with Database Filtering:
  - Identified database count discrepancy: 59 total (22 valid + 37 invalid old bets without game_name)
  - Fixed case sensitivity issue: "Test System 01" vs "TEST SYSTEM 01" causing incorrect counting
  - Updated getTotalSattaMatkaBets() method with case-insensitive filtering (UPPER(game_name) = 'TEST SYSTEM 01')
  - Admin panel now shows accurate count: 19 valid Test System 01 bets instead of incorrect 59
  - Eliminated counting of invalid legacy bet records, ensuring only authentic game bets are displayed
- July 22, 2025: Fixed Admin Panel Data Consistency - Card vs Dashboard Count Mismatch:
  - Resolved inconsistency: Test System 01 card showing 20 bets while dashboard showed 19 bets
  - Root cause: getGameBettingStats() method using description ILIKE condition counting extra invalid bets
  - Updated getGameBettingStats() method: removed description matching, added case-insensitive game_name filtering
  - Added status = 'completed' validation for consistent bet counting across all admin components
  - Achieved complete data consistency: all admin panel sections now show accurate 19 bets for Test System 01
- July 22, 2025: Enhanced Time Display and Revenue Consistency:
  - Fixed Today Revenue to show only active games revenue (â‚¹13,205) instead of all games including inactive
  - Updated getTodayRevenue() method with same filtering logic as bet counting for consistency
  - Fixed bet transaction time display from generic browser format to proper Indian timezone (Asia/Kolkata)
  - Implemented manual UTC to IST conversion (+5.5 hours) for accurate time display
  - Latest bet now shows correct time: 06:57:46 PM instead of incorrect 01:27:46 PM
  - All admin panel time displays now consistent with Indian Standard Time
- July 23, 2025: Advanced Date Range Filtering and Sorting System with Clean Modal Design:
  - Implemented comprehensive date range filtering with custom date picker and quick selection buttons
  - Added sorting functionality: Time, Amount, User Name with High-to-Low/Low-to-High ordering
  - Created elegant modal-based filter interface replacing bulky inline controls
  - Date display shows current selection (single date or range) next to compact Settings button
  - Backend APIs enhanced with IST timezone support for proper 6 AM daily reset logic
  - Number Betting Details supports real-time filtering and sorting without page refresh
  - Modal includes emoji-enhanced UI with organized sections for Date Range and Sorting Options
  - All filtering parameters properly passed through database queries with timezone conversion
- July 23, 2025: Consistent Analytics Filtering - Extended Date Filters to Main Satta Matka Analytics:
  - Added date range filtering functionality to main Satta Matka Analytics page
  - Implemented same modal-based filter system with Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, All Time options
  - Filter button positioned next to date display in header for consistency with detail pages
  - Analytics date state management separate from detail page filters (analyticsStartDate/EndDate)
  - Complete UI consistency across all admin analytics components with identical filter interface
  - Enhanced user experience with unified filtering approach across entire analytics section
- July 23, 2025: Fixed Total Bets Display - Today's Bets Only:
  - Modified getTotalSattaMatkaBets() method to show today's bets by default instead of all-time bets
  - Added IST timezone-aware date filtering when no date range is provided
  - Admin dashboard Total Bets counter now displays today's betting activity: 0 bets for July 23, 2025
  - Fixed user confusion where dashboard showed all 22 historical bets instead of current day activity
  - Maintains existing date range filtering functionality for analytics with custom date ranges
- July 23, 2025: Complete Filter Button Highlighting Fix Across All Admin Pages:
  - Fixed highlighting logic for Yesterday and Last 7 Days buttons in main Satta Matka Analytics modal
  - Fixed highlighting logic for Today, Yesterday, and Last 7 Days buttons in TEST SYSTEM 01 details page
  - Fixed highlighting logic for Today, Yesterday, and Last 7 Days buttons in Number Betting Details page
  - Replaced hardcoded variant="outline" with dynamic highlighting based on current date selection
  - All filter buttons now properly highlight when selected across entire admin panel interface
  - Consistent user experience: buttons turn blue when active, outline when inactive across all pages
- July 23, 2025: Default Filter Changed to "Today" Across All Admin Pages:
  - Changed default filter from "All Time" to "Today" for better admin dashboard experience
  - Admin Dashboard analytics now show today's data by default instead of historical data
  - Satta Matka Analytics page now defaults to today's filtering
  - TEST SYSTEM 01 details page now defaults to today's data
  - Number Betting Details page now defaults to today's data
  - Improved business logic: admins see current day activity first, can manually switch to historical data
  - Enhanced daily operations monitoring with immediate visibility of today's bets and revenue
- July 23, 2025: Complete UserBettingHistory Page Design Consistency:
  - Updated UserBettingHistory page styling to match View All Users page design
  - Applied same light blue gradient background across entire page
  - Implemented glass morphism effects with backdrop blur on all cards
  - User Profile Card: Blue gradient header with white text, same as other admin cards
  - Game Selection Cards: Reduced height to h-28, gradient backgrounds (blue/orange), compact layout
  - Betting History Section: Green gradient header with professional glass card design
  - All buttons, filters, and interactive elements maintain consistent styling throughout
  - Achieved complete visual consistency across admin dashboard interface
- July 23, 2025: Complete Filter System Conversion to Dropdown Format:
  - Converted TEST SYSTEM 01 page filter from modal popup to dropdown menu format
  - Replaced Settings icon with proper Filter icon throughout the interface for consistency
  - Added comprehensive filter and sort dropdown buttons to Number Betting Details page below summary cards
  - Filter dropdown: Blue gradient theme with glassmorphism effects, quick date selection (Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, All Time)
  - Sort dropdown: Purple gradient theme with sort by Time/Amount/User Name and High-to-Low/Low-to-High ordering
  - Both dropdowns feature proper highlighting when options are selected and consistent theme styling
  - All filter modals converted to dropdown format for better UX across analytics pages

## User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Hindi/Hinglish language responses.
Architecture preference: Separated microservices architecture (frontend, backend, database separate).

import * as React from "react"
import * as CheckboxPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-checkbox"
import { Check } from "lucide-react"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Checkbox = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <CheckboxPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-primary ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=checked]:bg-primary data-[state=checked]:text-primary-foreground",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator
      className={cn("flex items-center justify-center text-current")}
    >
      <Check className="h-4 w-4" />
    </CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator>
  </CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
))
Checkbox.displayName = CheckboxPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Checkbox }

client/src/components/ui/progress.tsx.content:
"use client"

import * as React from "react"
import * as ProgressPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-progress"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Progress = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, value, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ProgressPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative h-4 w-full overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ProgressPrimitive.Indicator
      className="h-full w-full flex-1 bg-primary transition-all"
      style={{ transform: `translateX(-${100 - (value || 0)}%)` }}
    />
  </ProgressPrimitive.Root>
))
Progress.displayName = ProgressPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Progress }

client/src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-scroll-area"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn("relative overflow-hidden", className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = "vertical", ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      "flex touch-none select-none transition-colors",
      orientation === "vertical" &&
        "h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]",
      orientation === "horizontal" &&
        "h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }

client/src/components/ui/slider.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as SliderPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-slider"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Slider = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <SliderPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative flex w-full touch-none select-none items-center",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <SliderPrimitive.Track className="relative h-2 w-full grow overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary">
      <SliderPrimitive.Range className="absolute h-full bg-primary" />
    </SliderPrimitive.Track>
    <SliderPrimitive.Thumb className="block h-5 w-5 rounded-full border-2 border-primary bg-background ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50" />
  </SliderPrimitive.Root>
))
Slider.displayName = SliderPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Slider }
